answers.answer: Awww so sorry you're having to go through this but it's in yours and the baby's best interest. Hang in there and I hope everything goes well for you. :)
Thank you, thats what I keep telling myself. My son was 10 lbs and I gave birth naturally so I am hoping this time this little guy will be smaller than 10. lol

Wow 10 lbs naturally, you're awesome! But I'm sure it was a healthy 10 lb baby so it's all good. My little one weighs 11 oz right now. I'm hoping she grows to be a healthy weight. I know you said your little prince is growing a little faster than the average...any idea how much he weighs right now? I have no clue where we should be with all of this because although everything looked normal with my little girl, she was measuring about a week behind. :)
I think he was 11 oz when I went in about 2 weeks ago and measuring 2 days ahead. Babies are funny they slow down in growth and then speed up and slow down again, I bet she will be perfect. =)
Awe thanks...she may be measuring a little behind but she's kicking like she's weeks ahead...LOL. Kiddos are funny that way.

question: Well I went to my Dietician/MD and they put my on insulin injections today I am sooo bummed. I have to do 3 injections a day, I was hoping to keep my levels down with diet but my fasting keeps coming up high. On a positive I've only gained 3 pounds this pregnancy which the MD says is fine since I needed to drop 30 to begin with. lol
title: Gestational Diabetes is sooo not fun
